intro: Phyteuma rigidifolium, commonly known as the rigid-leaved phyteuma, is a perennial plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its upright stems and showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from pink to purple. The plant typically grows in rocky or gravelly soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are rigid and linear, giving it a distinctive appearance, and it blooms from late summer into early autumn. Phyteuma rigidifolium is valued in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
